shortdesc: Set the sign to positive or negative.

example.description: Make value negative by giving any negative number as the argument.
example.longcode:
<<node>>
var RationalNumber = require('rational-number');
<</node>>
var rn = RationalNumber();
rn.setValue(1, 2);
console.log('Value of number before .setSign():', rn.toString());
rn.setSign(-1);
console.log('Value of number after .setSign():', rn.toString());
example.longoutput:
Value of number before .setSign(): 1/2
Value of number after .setSign(): -1/2

example.description: The sign can be set by another RationalNumber.
example.longcode:
<<node>>
var RationalNumber = require('rational-number');
<</node>>
var rn = RationalNumber();
rn.setValue(1, 2);
console.log('Value of number before .setSign():', rn.toString());
rn.setSign(-1);
console.log('Value of number after .setSign():', rn.toString());
example.longoutput:
Value of number before .setSign(): 1/2
Value of number after .setSign(): -1/2

example.description: Make value positive by giving any non-negative number as the argument.
example.longcode:
<<node>>
var RationalNumber = require('rational-number');
<</node>>
var rn = RationalNumber();
rn.setValue(1, 2);
console.log('Value of number before .setSign():', rn.toString());
rn.setSign(-1);
console.log('Value of number after .setSign():', rn.toString());
example.longoutput:
Value of number before .setSign(): -1/2
Value of number after .setSign(): 1/2

example.description: Use a text string to set the sign.
example.longcode:
<<node>>
var RationalNumber = require('rational-number');
<</node>>
var rn = RationalNumber();
rn.setValue(1, 2);
console.log('Value of number before .setSign():', rn.toString());
rn.setSign('negative');
console.log('Value of number after .setSign():', rn.toString());
rn.setSign('positive');
console.log('Value of number after .setSign():', rn.toString());
example.longoutput:
Value of number before .setSign(): 1/2
Value of number after .setSign('negative'): -1/2
Value of number after .setSign('positive'): 1/2

example.description:
If a string starts with '-' the value will be set to negative.  If the string is '+', or anything, 
other than 'negative', the value will be set to positive.
example.longcode:
<<node>>
var RationalNumber = require('rational-number');
<</node>>
var rn = RationalNumber();
rn.setValue(1, 2);
console.log('Value of number before .setSign():', rn.toString());
rn.setSign('-');
console.log('Value of number after .setSign():', rn.toString());
rn.setSign('+');
console.log('Value of number after .setSign():', rn.toString());
example.longoutput:
Value of number before .setSign(): 1/2
Value of number after .setSign('-'): -1/2
Value of number after .setSign('+'): 1/2
